title.narrative: Tunisia: UGTT’s access to knowledge on issues related to the committees of the Social Contract process improved.

description.narrative: Assessment of the impact on the project’s implementation and description of any counteractive measures: The region is highly volatile and in particular political or civil instability is likely. In Tunisia, new terrorist attacks are very likely to happen. Egypt suffers from high level of political and civil instability. In contrast, the situation is presently more stable in Morocco and Jordan. In Tunisia, UGTT is a strong partner, able to continue to implement. It is estimated that UGTT would be a spearheading agent within civil society for the return to stable conditions. In Egypt, the operational space for trade unions and CSO’s have been drastically reduced. The LO/FTF Council was asked by the government to cease all activities in the country.

It is estimated that UGTT would be a spearheading agent within civil society for the return to stable conditions. title.narrative: Morocco: Joint knowledge among the trade union confederation partners about dialogue and negotiation techniques.

description.narrative: Assessment of the impact on the project’s implementation and description of any counteractive measures: The relationship between the four trade union partners in Morocco is delicate and has from the outset been among the main challenges to achieving results in a cost-efficient manner. The new approach in Morocco, is to focus on bipartite activities with CGEM/DI and to keep direct bilateral support to the four partners at a minimum. The new approach is developed in order to lower the risks of conflicts between the trade unions and to increase their commitment.

title.narrative: Youth: Number of youth network exchange visits to either Denmark or a country in the MENA-region.
Youth: Number of youth network exchange visits to either Denmark or a country in the MENA-region.
Jordan: Trade union trainers and shop stewards possess knowledge of modern social dialogue and CBAs with focus on women and vulnerable groups.
Jordan: Trade union trainers and shop stewards possess knowledge of modern social dialogue and CBAs with focus on women and vulnerable groups.
Egypt: Trade union trainers and shop stewards possess knowledge of modern social dialogue and CBAs.
Egypt: Trade union trainers and shop stewards possess knowledge of modern social dialogue and CBAs.
MENA-Denmark dialogue and partnerships at the political level as well as creating gender and youths networks to exchange experiences and best practices within Social Dialogue.

description.narrative: The objectives of the two established MENA-DK networks on youth and equality are “strengthening young people’s participation in public life“ (DAPP intermediate objective 1.3) and “to increase women’s participation in social, political and economic life” (DAPP intermediate objective 2.2), respectively. The corresponding key outcomes are: Youth: Number of trade union youth organisations in the MENA-region and in Denmark attains practical experience with dialogue and cooperation across political, cultural, geographical and other divides. The programme is on track. Equality: Number of networks among trade union women in Denmark and the MENA-region established and maintained, thereby enhancing their capacity to address and further women’s participation in political processes in the MENA-region. The programme is on track.

title.narrative: Establishment of mechanisms of Social Dialogue for policy reform within social and economic development

description.narrative: To achieve this outcome, the programme focusses on projects in Egypt and Jordan: Egypt: New gender sensitive social dialogue platforms (SDP) established in the regions of Egypt. Status: The programme was well on track, however, due to the political situation in Egypt, the LO/FTF Council was asked by the government to cease all activities in the country. Jordan: Organisational knowledge GFJTU and federations of challenges at the Jordanian labour market, including migration influx. Status: The programme is on track.

title.narrative: Awareness raising and protection of workers’ rights by increasing the capacity of trade unions to advocate for awareness on freedom of association and protection of workers’ rights

description.narrative:
To achieve this outcome, the programme focusses on projects in Tunisia and Morocco. Tunisia: Number of texts adopted by the tripartite partners in the social contract committees, which include proposals and/or recommendations of the UGTT. Status: Partly on track as one of four texts (four being the target for the programme cooperation) has been adopted by the tripartite partners in the social contract committees
Morocco: Coordination takes place between the trade union confederation partners and the employers’ organisation in Morocco. Status: On track as coordination has increased, among other with a joint visit to Denmark in 2015.
